title: Poncho (video game)
text:
Released for <a href="Microsoft%20Windows">Windows</a>, <a href="MacOS">OS X</a>, and <a href="PlayStation%204">PlayStation 4</a> on November 3, 2015, and <a href="PlayStation%20Vita">PlayStation Vita</a> and <a href="Wii%20U">Wii U</a> on August 18, 2016, Poncho (stylized as PONCHO) is an <a href="action%20game">action game</a> developed by <a href="Delve%20Interactive">Delve Interactive</a>.
Gameplay.
The game consists of a robot wearing a poncho. Humanity has disappeared and only robots remain. Players make their mission through the world of pixelated parallax to find Poncho's maker and save humanity. The gameplay consists of a 2D <a href="Platform%20game">platformer</a> with different layer of depth, being able to get closer or further away.
Reception.
The PC version has been reviewed on <a href="Destructoid">Destructoid</a> with a score of 60/100. The PS4 version has been reviewed on Hardcore Gamer with a score of 80/100. On <a href="PSU.com">PSU.com</a>, also for the PS4 version, the game was reviewed with a score of 80/100. On <a href="GameCrate">GameCrate</a>, the game's review score was 78/100. On <a href="Push%20Square">Push Square</a>, the review score was 50/100. Hardcore Gamer compared the game to <a href="Fez%20%28video%20game%29">Fez</a>.
The game was a commercial failure. In a blog post at <a href="Gamasutra">Gamasutra</a> published over a year after the game's release, Dan Hayes, a developer at Delve stated their company had "not yet made a single penny from "Poncho"". He further blamed Rising Star Games for a lack of support; the publisher responded by stating that Delve had consistently missed milestones.
